translation: Target Model for Blur Generation (Pmx)

id: ブレ生成対象モデルPmxファイルを選択してください
translation: Please select the target model Pmx file for blur generation

id: ブレ生成対象モデルの使い方
translation:
How to use the target model for blur generation:
・You can set the Pmx model to which you want to add blur settings
・You can select the string in the model name field
Motion for Confirmation (Vmd/Vpd)

id: 確認用モーション(Vmd/Vpd)ファイルを選択してください
translation: Please select the motion file for confirmation (Vmd/Vpd)

id: 確認用モーションの使い方
translation:
How to use the motion for confirmation:
・You can set the motion Vmd or Vpd optionally
・You can select the string in the model name field in the motion
Output Model (Pmx)

id: 出力モデル(Pmx)ファイルパスを指定してください
translation: Please specify the file path for the output model (Pmx)

How to use the output model:
・You can set the file path for the output model with blur settings
・The output path is automatically set, but you can change it to any path
Proceed to the next step
Save
Preview
Cancel the preview and readjust

Step 1:
・Please specify the Pmx model to which you want to add blur settings
・Motion settings are optional
・Click the 'Proceed to the next step' button at the bottom once you have confirmed the model display

The target model for blur settings has been successfully loaded.
Proceed to Step 2 tab

Failed to load the target model for blur settings.
Please check if the correct file path is specified

Step 2:
・Ensure that only the material for which you want to add blur settings is selected
・In the case of a Japanese sword, select only the material related to the blade

The target material for blur settings has been successfully set.
Proceed to Step 3 tab

No target material for blur settings has been selected.
Please select at least one material for which you want to add blur settings

Step 3:
・Select one vertex at the starting point of the ridge (mine) part of the material for which you want to add blur settings
・In the case of a Japanese sword, this is the mune-machi
・If there are overlapping vertices at the same location, they are displayed separated by commas
・If you mistakenly select a vertex, select it again to deselect it

The starting vertex of the ridge for blur settings has been successfully set.
Proceed to Step 4 tab

No starting vertex of the ridge for blur settings has been selected.
Please select one vertex at the starting point of the ridge part of the material for which you want to add blur settings

Step 4:
・Select one vertex at the tip of the material for which you want to add blur settings
・If there are overlapping vertices at the same location, they are displayed separated by commas
・If you mistakenly select a vertex, select it again to deselect it

The tip vertex for blur settings has been successfully set.
Proceed to Step 5 tab

No tip vertex for blur settings has been selected.
Please select one vertex at the tip part of the material for which you want to add blur settings

Step 5:
・Select the vertices of the blade part that you want to display as blur in the material for which you want to add blur settings
・The order of selection does not matter
・If there are overlapping vertices at the same location, they are displayed separated by commas
・If you mistakenly select a vertex, select it again to deselect it

Blade setting target vertex is not selected.
Please select the vertices of the blade part you want to display as blade.
Generation Failed
Generation Successful

Failed to generate the model with blur settings
Error message: {{.Error}}

Successfully generated the model with blur settings
The preview model is rotating over the original model
[Checkpoints]
・Ensure the blur extends only towards the ridge side …
　To represent momentum, the blur material is set to extend only towards the ridge side
　(The blur material extends in the opposite direction of the downward swing)
　Check that the blur is not extending in an odd direction
　(Red morph is added to make the blur part more noticeable)
・Ensure there are no missing vertices in the blur material …
　Only the vertices on the ridge side are set to extend as blur, and the vertices on the blade side follow the main body.
　If there are holes in the blur material, it means some necessary vertices were not selected in Step 5 of the blade vertex selection.
　In that case, please redo from the 'Retry' button
Output Failed
Output Successful

Failed to output the model with blur settings
Error message: {{.Error}}

Successfully output the model with blur settings
By default, the blur material {{.Path}}
No Output Model

id: 出力モデルなしメッセージ
translation:
No model with blur settings available for output.
Please redo the preview
Setting failed
